title: 'Open with' option not available for attachments
content: I've inadvertently made some change to 'Open with' so that when I add an attachment I can not open it within the email I'm sending. It opens for the recipient but not for me. When I click on the attachment nothing happens. It doesn't occur for all attachments but it seems to be for any attachment requiring 'Photos' as the option to open. Can you help please?

title: I can't see any of my folders in Thunderbird, and it's asking me to set up an account.
content:
Hi,

My computer crashed, and when it came back up I'm unable to locater any of my folders in Thunderbird. THis is a HUGE problem for me, as I have SO MUCH stored in the folders there. When I close and restart Thunderbird, it asks me to "Set Up Your Exising Email Address" Blow that it says, "To use your current email address fill in your credentials. Thunderbird will automatically search for a working and recommended server configuration."

So, I think it's treating me like I don't have an account, but I can see my address book with like 4,200 contacts in there.

Please help! Thanks so much in advance.

Danny
creator: dsiudara

title: attachments
content:
Dear Mozilla volunteer,

I tried to attach a file created in MS Word 365 to an outgoing Thunderbird email message on a desktop computer running Windows 11. An error message immediately said "file not implemented", and it would not accept this message as an attachment. I asked Google how to implement this file, and its reply was a completely inscrutable AI-generated set of instructions readable only by a professionally trained IT expert (if indeed such a person even could read it).

My question to you is: How do I "implement" a file so that Thunderbird will accept it as an attachment? OR: Can you modify Thunderbird somehow so that "implementation" is not required?

Thank you for considering this question.

Richard R. Vance rvance@ucla.edu
creator: rvance1987

title: I can't send emails with attachments (3mb), it keeps loading and fails.
content: Since a couple of days I have a problem with Thunderbird. I can send normal emails without attachments and I have no problem, but when I attach, it keeps loading in 12%, as if it was checking the files, and from there it doesn't go beyond that until it gives a timeout error. I have tried with another email client and it has worked without problem from the same computer. I have paused the antivirus protection in case that was the problem, but it hasn't been the case.
creator: samuelprcns
